column1: Every year, you should have an eye exam by an eye doctor (ophthalmologist).
High blood sugar can also cause blurred vision that is not related to diabetic retinopathy.
This kind of blurred vision is caused by having too much sugar and water in the lens of the eye, which is in front of the retina.
- If you take medicines to control your blood pressure, take them as your doctor instructs.
If you already have eye problems, ask your doctor if you should avoid exercises that can strain the blood vessels in your eyes.
If your vision is affected by diabetes, make sure your home is safe enough that your chance of falling is low.
For people with diabetes, the combination of poor vision and nerve problems in the legs and feet can affect balance.
- You have pain in your eyes.
- You see spots floating in your eyes.
